newsitem.title: POLAND: INVESTMENT RISK ON DECLINE IN POLAND - INSTITUTE.
newsitem.headline: INVESTMENT RISK ON DECLINE IN POLAND - INSTITUTE.

text.p: Investment risk in the majority
of Poland's industry and service sectors declined in 1996 as
firms found and filled new market niches created by a growing
economy, an independent economic think-tank said on Thursday.
"Overall investment risk fell as the economy grew, firms
restructured and the economic climate remained positive,"
Bohdan Wyznikiewicz, deputy chief of the Institute of Market
Economic Research (IBnGR) told a news conference.
The IBnGR said investment risk in sectors such as computer
production and medical services fell most significantly in 1996
while exposure to high-risk coal mining became even more
dangerous last year. It gave no sector forecasts for this year.
The Gdansk-based institute categorised nearly 300 industry,
construction and services sectors into five risk categories on
the basis of 20 criteria including firm effectiveness,
structural and systematic changes.
